alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; East Glacier Park Region; Eastern Glacier, Western Toole, and Central Pondera; Eastern Toole and Liberty; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 09 at 2:59AM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow or flurries will gradually diminish through the rest of this morning with little or no additional accumulation expected. A strong Pacific storm system moving across the area Friday will bring snow and gusty east winds, shifting to the northwest Friday afternoon and evening. A period of moderate to heavy snowfall rates Friday afternoon and evening could combine with gusty winds for significant blowing and drifting of snow and hazardous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
